intro: Euphrasia eliasii, commonly known as Elias's eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the western United States. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and branching. Euphrasia eliasii is often found in meadows and open slopes at elevations ranging from 6,000 to 12,000 feet.
